Alabama Code 17: 6-21(c) states that any withdrawal must occur at least 76 days before Election Day, making it too late to print new ballots.
Alabama: s "sore loser" law prevents primary losers from making a second run in the same election as an independent, but it only applies to names printed on the ballot, which is already set.
Alabama Secretary of State John Merrill: loser law would not prevent Luther Strange from running as a write-in candidate.
According to the Alabama Secretary of St: there are no existing stipulations that prohibit a candidate from being elected despite having unsuccessfully run for a party's nomination, which would normally apply due to Alabama's sore loser law.
